document_api_meta.title: Search Global Products
document_api_meta.env_desc:
Retrieve a list of global products that meet the specified conditions. 
This API will only return the key product properties. You can pass a returned global product ID to the [Get Global Product API](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/6509e2b0bace3e02b7490c96) to obtain more details about the product.

request_header_param.name: x-tts-access-token
request_header_param.desc: The seller access_token value from [Get Access Token](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/678e3a3292b0f40314a92d75#Get%20Access%20Token%20API), when user_type = 0. Follow this [guide](https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/678e3a344ddec3030b238fa0) to get seller access_token.

request_query_param.name: app_key
request_query_param.desc: Every single app will have a unique key. Please use the specific key assigned to your app.

request_query_param.name: sign
request_query_param.desc: Signature generated by gen algorithm. When you send API requests to TTS, you must sign them so that TTS can identify the senders.

request_query_param.name: timestamp
request_query_param.desc: Unix timestamp GMT (UTC+00:00). This timestamp is used across all API requests. Developers can use this convert to local time.

request_query_param.name: page_size
request_query_param.desc:
The number of results to be returned per page. 
Valid range: [1-100]

request_query_param.name: page_token
request_query_param.desc: An opaque token used to retrieve the next page of a paginated result set. Retrieve this value from the result of the `next_page_token` from a previous response. It is not needed for the first page.

request_body_param.name: status
request_body_param.desc:
Filter global products by their status.
Possible values:
- PUBLISHED
- UNPUBLISHED
- DRAFT
- DELETED

request_body_param.name: seller_skus
request_body_param.desc: Filter global products by these seller SKU codes.

request_body_param.name: create_time_ge
request_body_param.desc:
Filter global products to show only those that are created on or after the specified date and time. Unix timestamp.

**Note**:
The "create_time_ge" and "create_time_le" together constitute the creation time filter condition.
- If "create_time_ge" is filled but "create_time_le" is empty, "create_time_le" will default to the current time.
- If "create_time_le" is filled but "create_time_ge" is empty, "create_time_ge" will default to the earliest shop time.

request_body_param.name: create_time_le
request_body_param.desc:
Filter global products to show only those that are created on or before the specified date and time. Unix timestamp.
Refer to notes in "create_time_ge" for more usage information.

request_body_param.name: update_time_ge
request_body_param.desc:
Filter global products to show only those that are updated on or after the specified date and time. Unix timestamp.

**Note**:
The fields "update_time_ge" and "update_time_le" together define the update time filter condition.
- If "update_time_ge" is filled but "update_time_le" is empty, "update_time_le" will default to the current time.
- If "update_time_le" is filled but "update_time_ge" is empty, "update_time_ge" will default to the earliest shop time.

request_body_param.name: update_time_le
request_body_param.desc:
Filter global products to show only those that are updated on or before the specified date and time. Unix timestamp.
Refer to notes in `update_time_ge` for more usage information.

response_param.name: code
response_param.desc: The success or failure status code returned in API response.

response_param.name: message
response_param.desc: The success or failure messages returned in API response. Reasons of failure will be described in the message.

response_param.name: ^next_page_token
response_param.desc: An opaque token used to retrieve the next page of a paginated result set. Provide this value in the `page_token` parameter of your request if the current response does not return all the results.

response_param.name: ^total_count
response_param.desc: The total number of global products that meet the query conditions.

response_param.name: ^global_products
response_param.desc: The list of global products that meet the query conditions.

response_param.name: ^^id
response_param.desc: The global product ID in TikTok Shop.

response_param.name: ^^title
response_param.example: Men's Fashion Sports Low Cut Cotton Breathable Ankle Short Boat Invisible Socks

response_param.name: ^^status
response_param.desc:
The status of the product.
Possible values:
- PUBLISHED
- UNPUBLISHED
- DRAFT
- DELETED

response_param.name: ^^skus
response_param.desc: A list of global Stock Keeping Units (SKUs) used to identify distinct variants of the product.

response_param.name: ^^^id
response_param.desc: The global SKU ID in TikTok Shop. One product can contain multiple SKU IDs.

response_param.name: ^^^seller_sku
response_param.desc: An internal code/name for managing SKUs, not visible to buyers.

response_param.name: ^^create_time
response_param.desc:
The time when the product is created.
Unix timestamp.

response_param.name: ^^update_time
response_param.desc:
The time when the product is last updated.
Unix timestamp.

error_code_list.msg: The number of SKU exceed the limit
The total number of search results can not exceed 10000.
Internal error. Please try again. If the issue persists after multiple attempts, please contact platform support.
The product in its current status is not available for this operation. Change the product status and try again.
Invalid input parameters. Refer to the API documentation for details.

sample_code.label: Go
sample_code.value:
// For more details about the SDK, refer to the documentation:
// https://partner.tiktokshop.com/docv2/page/67c83e0799a75104986ae498
func product202312SearchGlobalProductsPost() {
    configuration := apis.NewConfiguration()
    configuration.AddAppInfo(appKey, appSecret)
    apiClient := apis.NewAPIClient(configuration)
    request := apiClient.ProductV202312API.Product202312GlobalProductsSearchPost(context.Background())
    request = request.XTtsAccessToken("your access token")
    request = request.ContentType("application/json")
    request = request.PageSize(100)
    request = request.PageToken("b2Zmc2V0PTAK")
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody := product_v202312.NewProduct202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody()
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody.SetStatus("PUBLISHED")
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBodySellerSkusList := []string{"Color-Red-001"}
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody.SetSellerSkus(product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBodySellerSkusList)
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody.SetCreateTimeGe(1694576429)
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody.SetCreateTimeLe(1694576429)
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody.SetUpdateTimeGe(1694576429)
    product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody.SetUpdateTimeLe(1694576429)
    request = request.Product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody(*product202312SearchGlobalProductsRequestBody)
    resp, httpResp, err := request.Execute()
    if err != nil || httpResp.StatusCode != 200 {
        fmt.Printf("productsRequest err:%v resbody:%s", err, httpResp.Body)
        return
    }
    if resp == nil {
        fmt.Printf("response is nil")
        return
    }
    if resp.GetCode()!= 0 {
        fmt.Printf("response business is error, errorCode:%d errorMessage:%s", resp.GetCode(), resp.GetMessage())
        return
    }
    respDataJson, _ := json.MarshalIndent(resp.GetData(), "", "  ")
    fmt.Println("response data:", string(respDataJson))
    return
}

scope_list.package_description: The Partner will be able to access seller's global product information.
scope_list.auth_info: The Partner will be able to access your global product information such as sku, stock, etc.
